content: this teddy bear lovey crochet pattern is perfect as a newborn baby gift or to sell at market stalls it s an intermediate-level pattern made using worsted weight yarn while all the details are listed below here s a quick overview this bear lovey involves colour changes working in the round and the lemon peel stitch if you re comfortable with colour changes and crocheting in the round even confident beginners can give it a try the pattern is free to view on my blog here 1 but if you d prefer a printable ad-free pdf version it s available to purchase in my ravelry store materials needed ---------------- * **yarn ** aran/worsted weight yarn i recommend paintbox yarns cotton aran or yarn and colors epic in the following colours oak 80grams = 120m/131yds light blue 50grams = 85m/93yds dark blue 24grams = 41m/45yds natural 1 gram = 1 7m/1 85yds * **crochet hook ** size 4mm g & 5mm h * **other materials ** stuffing needle scissors pins stitch marker black embroidery thread or 8mm safety eyes scrap black dk yarn for nose bear lovey size --------------- using the yarn and hooks specified in this pattern my creation was 45cm/17 8 long from corner to opposite corner across the blanket by 31cm/12 2 high from the top of the head to the bottom of the blanket gauge ----- gauge is not required for this pattern however keep gauge consistent throughout for reference my gauge was as follows amigurumi pieces 4mm hook 6 single_crochet stitches on 2 5cm/ 1 6 row on 2 5cm/ 1 blanket 5mm hook 8 double_crochet sts on 5cm/2 5 3 row on 5cm/2 5 additional information ---------------------- * **pattern language ** english * **pattern terms ** us terms * **stitches used ** magic_ring chain slip_stitch single_crochet double_crochet lemon peel stitch alternating single_crochet & double_crochet increases and decreases * **yarn ** the yarn choice is completely up to you and you can change the yarn weight material and colours based on your own personal preference just be aware that the weight of your yarn may impact the hook size you need to use and also the size of your final make * **hook size ** i recommend using a smaller hook size than recommended on the yarn label for the amigurumi pieces this will stop the stuffing from appearing through your stitches you will also need to change crochet hook size for the blanket * **eyes ** in this pattern you have the choice of using safety eyes or embroidered eyes instructions are included for both please note that safety eyes are a choking hazard and are not suitable for children under 3 years of age * **working in rounds ** all parts within this pattern are worked in continuous rounds unless otherwise stated * **x-shaped single_crochet ** for all amigurumi parts i have used the
